content:
I am currently a third-year undergraduate student at Indian Institute of Technology Bombay pursuing a major in Electrical Engineering and a minor in Computer Science and Engineering. I am a Deep Learning Enthusiast and starting to become an avid Kaggler.
I am an incoming intern at University of Tubingen under Prof. Jacob Macke. I’m also currently involved in two RnD projects under Prof. Biplab Banerjee
I have been a part of Unmesh Mashruwala Innovation Cell (UMIC) in my first two years, where I have worked on developing a Driverless Car. I did an internship as a Deep Learning Researcher in the field of Healthcare with Endimension Technologies Pvt. Ltd..
Welcome to my space !!!
summary: I am currently a third-year undergraduate student at Indian Institute of Technology Bombay pursuing a major in Electrical Engineering and a minor in Computer Science and Engineering. I am a Deep Learning Enthusiast and starting to become an avid Kaggler.
title: Hitesh Kandala

Click on the Slides button above to view the built-in slides feature.   Slides can be added in a few ways:
 Create slides using Wowchemy’s Slides feature and link using slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file Upload an existing slide deck to static/ and link using url_slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file Embed your slides (e.g. Google Slides) or presentation video on this page using shortcodes.  Further event details, including page elements such as image galleries, can be added to the body of this page.

title: Example Talk

content:
Overview  The Wowchemy website builder for Hugo, along with its starter templates, is designed for professional creators, educators, and teams/organizations - although it can be used to create any kind of site The template can be modified and customised to suit your needs. It’s a good platform for anyone looking to take control of their data and online identity whilst having the convenience to start off with a no-code solution (write in Markdown and customize with YAML parameters) and having flexibility to later add even deeper personalization with HTML and CSS You can work with all your favourite tools and apps with hundreds of plugins and integrations to speed up your workflows, interact with your readers, and much more    The template is mobile first with a responsive design to ensure that your site looks stunning on every device.  Get Started  üëâ Create a new site üìö Personalize your site üí¨ Chat with the Wowchemy community or Hugo community üê¶ Twitter: @wowchemy @GeorgeCushen #MadeWithWowchemy üí° Request a feature or report a bug for Wowchemy ‚¨ÜÔ∏è Updating Wowchemy? View the Update Guide and Release Notes  Crowd-funded open-source software To help us develop this template and software sustainably under the MIT license, we ask all individuals and businesses that use it to help support its ongoing maintenance and development via sponsorship.
‚ù§Ô∏è Click here to become a sponsor and help support Wowchemy’s future ‚ù§Ô∏è As a token of appreciation for sponsoring, you can unlock these awesome rewards and extra features ü¶Ñ‚ú®
Ecosystem  Hugo Academic CLI: Automatically import publications from BibTeX  Inspiration Check out the latest demo of what you’ll get in less than 10 minutes, or view the showcase of personal, project, and business sites.
Features  Page builder - Create anything with widgets and elements Edit any type of content - Blog posts, publications, talks, slides, projects, and more! Create content in Markdown, Jupyter, or RStudio Plugin System - Fully customizable color and font themes Display Code and Math - Code highlighting and LaTeX math supported Integrations - Google Analytics, Disqus commenting, Maps, Contact Forms, and more! Beautiful Site - Simple and refreshing one page design Industry-Leading SEO - Help get your website found on search engines and social media Media Galleries - Display your images and videos with captions in a customizable gallery Mobile Friendly - Look amazing on every screen with a mobile friendly version of your site Multi-language - 34+ language packs including English, ‰∏≠Êñá, and Portugu√™s Multi-user - Each author gets their own profile page Privacy Pack - Assists with GDPR Stand Out - Bring your site to life with animation, parallax backgrounds, and scroll effects One-Click Deployment - No servers. No databases. Only files.  Themes Wowchemy and its templates come with automatic day (light) and night (dark) mode built-in. Alternatively, visitors can choose their preferred mode - click the moon icon in the top right of the Demo to see it in action! Day/night mode can also be disabled by the site admin in params.toml.
Choose a stunning theme and font for your site. Themes are fully customizable.

title: Welcome to Wowchemy, the website builder for Hugo

content:
In summer 2020, when the whole world was caught in a pandemic, I hopefully landed an internship at Endimension Technology Pvt Ltd., a healthcare Aritificial Intelligence startup incubated at IIT Bombay. Problem Statement: To classify if a patient has pneumonia or not, and if he/she has then to detect regions of fluid in the chest X-rays.
Data: The dataset consisted of images of chest X-rays of Indian patients in different formats such as Dicom, NifTI, jpg, etc.
Overview of work done: I, first of all, had to build a pre-processing pipeline to feed images of different formats and different sizes.
I implemented a tensorflow model and experimented and optimized different object detection models and ensembled them to improve metrics.
In my one month work, I achieved sensitivity and specificity of more than 90% on the test dataset, consisting of over 3000 images.
Note : The actual deep learning architecture used is confidential as per company policy.
summary: Work done as a part of my 2nd year summer internship at Endimension Technology Pvt Ltd.
title: Pneumonia Detection

content:
The project started at the time when everyone was shut in their homes, owing to the worldwide pandemic. This was done as a part of Seasons of Code (SOC) organised by Web and Coding Club (WnCC), IIT Bombay. I co-ordinated in a team of 8, to build a real-time system that monitors network traffic for malicious activity. This was done with the help of raw network packet sniffer with a machine learning model detecting threats in the background.
  Block diagram of IDS.  My Contributions:  My major work was related to supervising the first year students and building a machine learning model to detect threats. For this, I read many reasearch papers to find out which type of model performs best and which dataset to use. We finally chose CICIDS2017 dataset as this was quite recent and relevant. I then applied Pearson Correlation and Chi-square test to this dataset to select best 15 out of 81 features. I trained the chosen features with an ensemble model (consisting of classifiers such as Random-Forest, ExtraTrees, KNN, etc.) to achieve around 99% accuracy but the model was slow in making predictions and was practically not possible to use it. Then I trained with each of the classifiers and found that KNN and ExtraTrees gave that accuracy to the ensemble model and the delay was mainly because of KNN. Finally using ExtraTrees classifier, I achieved an accuracy of 99.7%, and with greatly reduced inference time.
summary: Project done as a part of Seasons of Code organised by Web and Coding Club, IIT Bombay, to detect malicious activity in network traffic.
title: Intrusion Detection System

content:
I was a part of Team SeDriCa consisting of around 20 members. We were one of the 11 finalists among 289 teams competing in the Mahindra RISE Driverless Car Challenge to build India's first self driving car targeting the level 5 autonomy and received a Mahindra E2O for development of the same.
  Our Mahindra E2O (SeDriCa)  In my initial months, I was mainly understanding and implementing models in the computer vision subsytem, training Traffic Sign and Traffic Light classifier based on Resnet-50 and Resnet-152 architectures.
I, then switched to handle Path Planning and Decision Making subsytem as CV modules were giving decent results. I went for on-ground testing of the vehicle (in the campus) and optimized the path of the vehicle accounting for the location and information of obstacles and traffic signals using Robot Operating System (ROS).
One of my major contribution in this subsytem was implementing RRT* algorithm and integrating with other modules through ROS, to improve the speed and accuracy of finding path which was previously using Hybrid-A*.
Our self driving car intro and in news here
  Our senior team members, last Christmas Eve'19
summary: Project done as a part of Mahindra RISE Driverless Car Challenge, to build India's first self-driving car targeting the level 5 autonomy.
title: Self Driving Car

content:
Create slides in Markdown with Wowchemy Wowchemy | Documentation
 Features  Efficiently write slides in Markdown 3-in-1: Create, Present, and Publish your slides Supports speaker notes Mobile friendly slides   Controls  Next: Right Arrow or Space Previous: Left Arrow Start: Home Finish: End Overview: Esc Speaker notes: S Fullscreen: F Zoom: Alt + Click PDF Export: E   Code Highlighting Inline code: variable
Code block:
porridge = "blueberry" if porridge == "blueberry": print("Eating...")   Math In-line math: $x + y = z$
Block math:
$$ f\left( x \right) = ;\frac{{2\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x - 4} \right)}}{{\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x + 1} \right)}} $$
 Fragments Make content appear incrementally
{{% fragment %}} One {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} **Two** {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} Three {{% /fragment %}}  Press Space to play!
One  Two  Three 
 A fragment can accept two optional parameters:
 class: use a custom style (requires definition in custom CSS) weight: sets the order in which a fragment appears   Speaker Notes Add speaker notes to your presentation
{{% speaker_note %}} - Only the speaker can read these notes - Press `S` key to view {{% /speaker_note %}}  Press the S key to view the speaker notes!
 Only the speaker can read these notes Press S key to view    Themes  black: Black background, white text, blue links (default) white: White background, black text, blue links league: Gray background, white text, blue links beige: Beige background, dark text, brown links sky: Blue background, thin dark text, blue links    night: Black background, thick white text, orange links serif: Cappuccino background, gray text, brown links simple: White background, black text, blue links solarized: Cream-colored background, dark green text, blue links   Custom Slide Customize the slide style and background
{{< slide background-image="/media/boards.jpg" >}} {{< slide background-color="#0000FF" >}} {{< slide class="my-style" >}}   Custom CSS Example Let’s make headers navy colored.
Create assets/css/reveal_custom.css with:
.reveal section h1, .reveal section h2, .reveal section h3 { color: navy; }   Questions? Ask
Documentation
summary: An introduction to using Wowchemy's Slides feature.
title: Slides

content:
In my freshmen year, I was recruited in the tech team Unmesh Mashruwala Innovation Cell along with 10 other freshmen and our first project was the competition "Student Design Challenge" organised every year by American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME). The competition required us to build a remote controlled bot of maximum dimensions 50x50, capable of picking, storing and placing balls of sizes ranging from table-tennis balls to as large as basket balls.
  Our bot, which we named "Deepu".  My Contributions  Programmed Roboteq to control the encoder-geared DC motors used to rotate the mechanum wheels. Programmed arduino to simultaneously control a stepper and 2 servo motors. Controlled the whole bot using transmitter during testing phase to improve speed and accuracy.  The code used for the competition is available here
Results After working hard for 3 months, we flew to Vellore for the Aisa-Pacific Regionals to compete with 20 other colleges from all over Asia. After 3 days of planning strategies and sleepless nights, we finally emerged as the Overall Winners of the Asia-Pacific Regionals. With this we qualified to represent India at the World Finals at Utah, USA in Nov 2019.
Some posts on our victory can be found here
  The winning team with the judges and our bot "Deepu"
summary: Project done as a part of competition - 'Student Design Challenge' organised by American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME).
title: ASME SDC 2019
